oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1943-09-04 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from September 4, 1943. Featuring Louie Buck (announcer), George D. Hay (host), and performers Pee Wee King and his Golden West Cowboys, Ernest Tubb and his Texas Troubadours, Minnie Pearl, Curley Williams and his Georgia Peach Pickers with vocalist Jimmie Selph, Mac McGar, and fiddler Hal (likely Hal Smith, unconfirmed). Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Mac McGar; Ernest Tubb; Texas Troubadours; Curley Williams; Georgia Peach Pickers; Jimmie Selph
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Trudy Brown interviews service men -- Louie Buck talks -- George D. Hay introduces Mac McGar -- Soldier's Joy (Mac McGar) -- George D. Hay introduces Ernest Tubb -- You Nearly Lose Your Mind (Ernest Tubb and his Texas Troubadours) -- Prince Albert commercial (Louie Buck, George D. Hay) -- George D. Hay introduces Curley Williams and his Georgia Peach Pickers -- When The Sun Goes Down (Curley Williams and his Georgia Peach Pickers, Jimmie Selph vocals) -- George D. Hay introduces Hal [Smith?] -- Fire On The Mountain (Hal [Smith?]) -- George D. Hay talks -- Ida Red -- Closing statement (George D. Hay)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Buck, Louis, 1910-1971; Hay, George D. (George Dewey), 1895-1968; King, Pee Wee, 1914-2000; Golden West Cowboys (Musical group); Minnie Pearl; McGar, Mac; Tubb, Ernest, 1914-1984; Texas Troubadours; Paige, Tommy; Williams, Curley, 1913-1970; Georgia Peach Pickers (Musical group); Fowler, Wally; Smith, Hal, 1923-2008; Selph, Jimmy; Williams, Sanford (Musician)
